Q_DESC:
To write a program in which the user has to perform operations in a linked list.
Flatten a multi-level linked list using Depth wise method
Flattening of a multi-level linked list where nodes have two pointers down and next to flatten a linked list when we always need to process down pointer before next at every node.
Input:  
1 - 2 - 3 - 4
    |
    7 -  8 - 10 - 12
    |    |    |
    9    16   11
    |    |
    14   17 - 18 - 19 - 20
    |                    |
    15 - 23             21
         |
         24
The order of the linked list is very important as this is supposed to be maintained while inputting the linked list.
Output:  
Linked List to be flattened to
1 - 2 - 7 - 9 - 14 - 15 - 23 - 24 - 8
 - 16 - 17 - 18 - 19 - 20 - 21 - 10 - 
11 - 12 - 3 - 4
Note : 9 appears before 8 (When we are 
at a node, we process down pointer before 
right pointer)
